intro: Siphocampylus cinerascens, commonly known as the ash-gray siphocampylus, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, characterized by its compound leaves and umbellate inflorescences. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils, often in arid or semi-arid environments. Its small, white to pale yellow flowers bloom in late spring to early summer. The species is noted for its medicinal properties, with traditional uses in Native American herbal medicine.
